de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core.io

Class LazyReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core.io.LazyReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.CharSequence

    public class LazyReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.CharSequence
    Reads the contents of a given source (e.g., file) as a sequence of chars. Does not attempt to read the whole source at once but in small parts to minimize the number of IO operations. Useful if only the beginning of a source is relevant.
    Author:
    Sebastian Krieter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LazyReader(java.io.InputStream stream)
      Constructs a new reader with the given input stream as source.
      Does NOT close the stream.
      LazyReader(java.io.Reader reader)
      Constructs a new reader with the given reader as source.

    • Method Detail

      • getContent

        public java.lang.String getContent()
        Returns the already read contents of the source. Use expand() to further read from the source.
        Returns:
        the beginning of the source as string.

      • expand

        public boolean expand()
        Reads more from the source.
        Returns:
        true if there is more data available after the read and false if the complete source was read or an IOException was thrown during the process.
